actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on August 2, 2024.

actions-list.header: Task Force on the Attempted Assassination of Donald J. Trump
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 1(b)(1) of House Resolution 1367, 118th Congress, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed the following members of the House to the Task Force on the Attempted Assassination of Donald J. Trump: Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Green of Tennessee, Mr. Waltz, Mr. Fallon, Ms. Lee of Florida, Mr. Crow, Mr. Correa, Ms. Dean of Pennsylvania, Ms. Houlahan, Mr. Ivey and Mr. Moskowitz.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Jim Jordan, Chairman, House Judiciary Committee. Pursuant to Section 4(b) of House Resolution 917, Mr. Jordan notified the House that the Committee on the Judiciary has commenced litigation against Merrick Garland, in his official capacity as Attorney General of the United States, to enforce a duly authorized, issued, and served congressional subpoena. The Committee filed the civil action, Committee on the Judiciary, U.S. House of Representatives v. Garland, No. 1:24-cv-01911, in the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia on July 1, 2024.

The House received a message from the Acting Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Acting Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on July 30, 2024, at 9:53 a.m.: That the Senate passed S. 3574 and S. 4610.
The Chair led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Journal of the last day's proceedings was approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable H. Morgan Griffith to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
